alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 22 at 3:16AM MDT until March 22 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR THE EAST CENTRAL AND NORTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND DRY FUELS... .A deepening lee side trough combined with strong winds aloft and good mixing will lead to very windy conditions today, especially across the eastern plains. Above normal temperatures are forecast across the eastern plains, where the combination of dry fine fuels and strong winds may support the rapid spread of fire. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 10 AM this morning to 8 PM MDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (Zone 104) and the East Central Plains (Zone 126) from 10 AM this morning to 8PM MDT this evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 25 to 35 mph with gusts to near 60 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...17 to 22 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended..
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
